text:
substance: Benzene | type_of_trv: Oral SF | trv_value: 8.3E-02
(mg/kg -day)–1
BW | study_details: Study Type: chronic
Species: rats and mice
Mode of Administration: gavage,
corn oil
Exposure Regime: 0, 50, 100, and
200 mg/kg -day (male rats); 0, 25,
BW
50, and 100 mg/kg -day (female rats,
BW
male and female mice), 5 days/week
Duration: 103 weeks
Uncertainty Factors: N/A | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: Range of unit risks
associated with
ingesting 1 µg/L of
benzene in water:
2.03E-06 to
4.17E-06 (µg/L)-1 | trv_derivation_method: Linearized multistage model
and allometric scaling
TRV based on upper bound
estimate of unit risks (URs)
in drinking water:
4.17E-06 (µg/L)-1
Conversion to oral SF in
(mg/kg -day)-1:
BW
Oral SF =
UR × BW × CF / IR
adult W
[where BW = 70.7 kg,
adult
IR = 1.5 L/day, and
W
CF = 1000 µg/mg] | critical_effect_s: Cancer
(malignant
lymphomas)
and
Bone marrow
hematopoietic
hyperplasia | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA: Group I
carcinogenic
to humans
(EC and HC, 1993b)
IARC: Group 1
carcinogenic
to humans
(IARC, 2012b)
US EPA IRIS:
Group A
carcinogenic
to humans
(US EPA, 2000a) | source: HC, 2009
(based on
NTP, 1986a)

substance: Benzene | type_of_trv: Inhalation UR | trv_value: 1.6E-02
(mg/m3)–¹ | study_details: Study Type: epidemiological
(occupational)
Species: human
Mode of Exposure: inhalation
Exposure Concentrations: N/A
Duration: chronic
Uncertainty Factors: N/A | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: Unit lifetime leukemia
risk to the general
population, derived
from these studies:
Ohio Pliofilm cohort:
0.044 (ppm)–1
[0.014 (mg/m3)–1]
Chinese cohorts:
0.056 (ppm)–1
[0.018 (mg/m3)–1] | trv_derivation_method: Poisson regression and
linear relative risk models
+
Inhalation UR for lifetime
inhalation exposures of
the general population
(based on the geometric
mean of upper bound
estimates of leukemia risk
from these studies)
Inhalation UR =
[0.044 (ppm)-1 ×
0.056 (ppm)-1] 1/2
= 0.050 (ppm)–1
[0.016 (mg/m3)–¹] | critical_effect_s: Cancer
(leukemia) | source: HC, 2013a
and
OEHHA, 2001
(based on
Rinsky et al.,
1987;
Paxton et al.,
1994;
Hayes et al., 1997)

substance: Benzo[a]pyrene
(BaP) | type_of_trv: Oral TDI | trv_value: 6.67E-05
mg/kg -day
BW | study_details: Study Type: developmental
Species: neonate Sprague-Dawley
rat pups (10 males and 10 females)
Mode of Administration: gavage
Exposure Regime: 0 (peanut oil only),
0.02, 0.2, or 2 mg/kg administered
BW
daily from postnatal day (PND) 5 until
PND 11
Duration: until PND 71
Uncertainty Factors: 300 (10 for
intraspecies variability, 10 for interspecies
variability, and 3 for database defciiencies) | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: NOAEL =
0.020 mg/kg -day
BW | trv_derivation_method: TDI = NOAEL/UF | critical_effect_s: Neuro-
developmental
toxicity | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA: Group II
probably
carcinogenic
to humans
(EC and HC, 1994a)
IARC: Group 1
carcinogenic
to humans
(IARC, 2012b)
US EPA carcinogenic
to humans
(US EPA, 2017) | source: HC, 2016a
(based on
Chen et al.,
2012)
